intro: Psychotria woronovii, commonly known as the Amazonian psychotria, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and clusters of small, white to greenish flowers. The plant is often found in humid, shaded environments within the rainforest canopy. It is known for its alkaloid content, which includes compounds similar to those found in ayahuasca. Due to its ecological and potential pharmacological significance, it is of interest to botanists and ethnobotrists.
